question: Þone soþan geleafan to (<em>bodian<em/>) #### — In order to preach the true faith
explanation: Here 'bodian' loses the —an suffix and gains 'enne' to make the inflected infinitive 'bodienne'

question: Heo onfeng þæt land, mynster to (timbrian) #### — She siezed that land in order to build a monastery
explanation: Here 'timbrian' loses the —an suffix and gains 'enne' to make the inflected infinitive 'timbrienne'

question: To hæbbenne and to (healdan) #### — To have and to hold
Nys þe alyfed to (habban) #### — þines broðer wif — It is not permitted to have your brother's wife
Hie næfdon hlaf to (etan) #### — They didn't have bread to eat
Ut eode se sædere his sæd to (sawan) #### — Out went the farmer, in order to sow his seeds
Gehire gif hwa earan hæbbe to (hieran) #### — Hear, if one has ears to hear!
Eaþere ys olfende to (faran) #### þurh nædle þyrel þonne se rica on godes rice ga — It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for the rich to go to god's kingdom
Hie wilniað lof and wuldor to hæbbenne (habban) #### — They wished to have praise and glory
He ferdon to Francrice, þæt land to (hergian) #### — They went to France in order to plunder that land
Heo ferde to circe, þæt godspell to (hieran) #### — She went to church to hear the gospel
Freolic to (libban) #### — In order to live free
Werode to (helpan) #### on gefeohte — In order to help the people in battle
Wið fefre hylpþ wæter to (drincan) #### — Against fever it helps to drink water
Heo ferde to Eoferwice, þa wicingas to (helpan) #### — She went to York in order to help the vikings
Under þinum anwealde ic wilnie to (wunian) #### — Under your rule I should want to live
To helle gecuman to (helpan) #### Adames cyne—Come to Hell in order to help Adam's kin
Mæst þearf is to (gehealdan) #### rihtne cristendom — It is most necessary to keep correct christianity
Hie sealdon Ceolwulfe Myrcna rice to (healdan) #### — They gave Ceolwulf the kingdom of Mercia to hold
Þæt ðæt folc hæfð genoh to (drincan) #### — in order that that people have enough to drink
He ferde þa siþþan to (feohtan) #### wið þone casere — He went then afterwards in order to fight with the emperor
